ch.ethz.ee.tik.sop.pisalib.variator
Class PopulationAbstract

java.lang.Object
  ch.ethz.ee.tik.sop.pisalib.variator.PopulationAbstract
Direct Known Subclasses:
Population
abstract class PopulationAbstract
extends java.lang.Object

Handles the PISA-specific behavior of the global population. Contains all PISA-specific parameters and specifies an abstract method to set them and test them for consistency. Defines abstract methods to initialize a global population, to variate the individuals (recombination and mutation), and to test for the stopping criterion of the EA. Provides methods to add, retrieve and remove individuals from the global population, to update the global population with the individuals given in the archive file, to copy individuals, to set parameters and to write the whole or a part of the population to a file.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Tamara Ulrich

Field Detail

globalPopulation

java.util.ArrayList<Individual> globalPopulation
The individuals generated during execution of the EA, which are considered for further use.

freeIdentities

java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> freeIdentities
The indices of the elements of the globalPopulation ArrayList which contain null. The indices of the individuals in the global population are static, which means that when the global population contains three individuals with the indices 1, 2 and 3 and the second individual is removed from the global population, the global population still contains three elements, but only the first and the third point to an individual, whereas the second is null. The freeIdentities list then contains of the single element 2.

parents

int[] parents
The individuals which have been selected (by the selector) for variation.

offspring

int[] offspring
The individuals generated by applying recombination and mutation to the parents (by the variator).

seed

int seed
The seed of the random generator. Two runs of the variator with the same seed generate the same result.

generation

int generation
The current generation of the population.

pollingInterval

int pollingInterval
The time interval in seconds in which the state file is checked in the state machine.

debugPrint

boolean debugPrint
Says whether the debug messages should be printed (true) or whether the variator should execute silently (false).

alpha

int alpha
The size of the initial population.

mu

int mu
The number of parents chosen by the selector for variation. Has to be equal to alpha.

lambda

int lambda
The number of offspring generated by variating the mu parents. Has to be equal to alpha.

dim

int dim
The number of objectives.

stateFile

java.lang.String stateFile
Communication file containing the state of the state machine. The file contains one single integer value.

archiveFile

java.lang.String archiveFile
Communication file containing the indices of the individuals which are considered for further use by the selector. The parents are a subset of these individuals. Each line of the file contains one single integer number (the index). Additionally, the first line is the number of indices and the last line is an END tag.

variatorFile

java.lang.String variatorFile
Communication file containing the indices of the offspring. The offspring is generated by the variator by applying recombination and mutation to the parents (which have been chosen by the selector). Each line of the file contains one integer number (the index) plus the objective space values of the corresponding individual. Additionally, the first line is the number of elements ((number of indices)*(number of objective space values + 1)) and the last line is an END tag.

selectorFile

java.lang.String selectorFile
Communication file containing the parents which have been chosen for variation by the selector. The selector chooses them from its own archive of reusable individuals (the indices of which are stored in the archive file) and the offspring generated by the variator. Each line of the file contains one single integer number (the index). Additionally, the first line is the number of indices and the last line is an END tag.

configFile

java.lang.String configFile
Communication file containing the the sizes of the initial population, of the parents and of the offspring as well as the number of objectives.

initialFile

java.lang.String initialFile
Communication file containing the initial population generated by the variator. Each line of the file contains one integer number (the index) plus the objective space values of the corresponding individual. Additionally, the first line is the number of elements ((number of indices)*(number of objective space values + 1)) and the last line is an END tag.

paramFileName

java.lang.String paramFileName
The name of the file which contains the user-defined variator parameters which are read in State 0.

outputFileName

java.lang.String outputFileName
The name of the file where the final population will be printed. After the last variation, the selector executes once more. All individuals which are contained in the archive file afterwards are written to the output file. For each individual, the index plus the objective space values are written.

commFilePath

java.lang.String commFilePath
Holds the path and name-parts of the communication files of the PISA protocol. For example if commFilePath is ./PISA_, then the variator file will be appended a var: ./PISA_var. The same goes for the status (sta), selector files (sel), initial files (ini), the archive files (arc) and the configuration files (cfg).

Constructor Detail

PopulationAbstract

public PopulationAbstract()
Constructor which instantiates the global Population and the freeIdentities list.

Method Detail

initialize

abstract void initialize()
Initializes the population with mu individuals.

performVariation

abstract void performVariation(int[] offspring)
Performs variation on a set of given individuals.

Parameters:
offspring - the indices of the individuals which have to be variated

isFinished

abstract boolean isFinished()
Tests if the stopping criterion of the EA has been met.

Returns:
true if the EA should stop, false if it should continue with the next generation

setNonfixedParam

abstract boolean setNonfixedParam(java.lang.String paramName,
                                  java.lang.String paramValue)
Sets the user-defined parameters. The parameter file can only contain parameters which are either handled in this method or in the setFixedParam method of the abstract population class PopulationAbstract.

Parameters:
paramName - the name of the parameter to be set
paramValue - the value of the parameter to be set
Returns:
true is the parameter has been successfully set, else false

testParam

abstract void testParam()
Tests the parameter for consistent values. If there are some values or value combination that should not be allowed (e.g. mu != lambda), the user can test them in this method. If all values are allowed, the method can be left empty.

performClean

void performClean()
Reads the individuals from the archive file and deletes all individuals which are not contained in this file from the global population. The archive file contains the individuals which are considered for further use by the selector. These individuals include the parents.

variate

public void variate()
Reads the selector file (containing the parents), makes a copy of them (called offspring) and adds the offspring to the global population. It then performs recombination and mutation on the offspring.

writePopulation

void writePopulation(java.lang.String filename)
writes the whole globalPopulation (only those individuals which are not listed in the freeIdentities list) to a file. It first prints the number of individuals, then the index of the individual followed by its objective space values and finally an END tag.

Parameters:
filename - the name of the file to be written (e.g. "./PISA_ini" or "./PISA_var")

writePopulation

void writePopulation(java.lang.String filename,
                     int[] identities)
writes the individuals with the given identities (with respect to the global population) to a file. It first prints the number of individuals, then the index of the individual followed by its objective space values and finally an END tag.

Parameters:
filename - the name of the file to be written (e.g. "./PISA_ini" or "./PISA_var")
identities - the indices of the individuals which have to be printed to the file

writeOutput

abstract void writeOutput()
Writes all individuals of the population to the output file. The name of the output file is specified in the parameter file.

setFixedParam

boolean setFixedParam(java.lang.String paramName,
                      java.lang.String paramValue)
Defines the possible set of parameters in the parameter and the configuration file. Returns false if given a parameter which is not listed in this method or if the parameter could not be set. User-defined parameters are set with a similar method setNonfixedParam in class Population.

Parameters:
paramName - the name of the parameter which has to be set
paramValue - the value of the parameter which has to be set
Returns:
true if the parameter has been set successfully, else false

getIndividual

Individual getIndividual(int id)
Takes an index and returns the individual which is located at this index in the global population

Parameters:
id - index of the individual
Returns:
the individual with the given index in the global population

copyIndividual

Individual copyIndividual(Individual ind)
Returns a copy of the given individual.

Parameters:
ind - individual to be copied
Returns:
copy of the given individual

addIndividual

int addIndividual(Individual ind)
Adds an individual to the global Population and returns the index, where the individual has been placed.

Parameters:
ind - individual which has to be added to the global population
Returns:
index, where the individual has been placed in the global Population

removeIndividual

void removeIndividual(int id)
Removes the individual with the given index from the global population. To do so, it sets the element of the global population at the given index to null and adds the index to the list of free identities freeIdentities.

Parameters:
id - index of the individual which has to be removed from the global population

evalIndividual

void evalIndividual(int id)
Updates the objective space values of the individual with the given index. If the decision space representation of an individual is changed, this function must be called to keep the objective space representation up to date.

Parameters:
id - index of the individual whose objective space values have to be evaluated
